The medication prescribed inhibits the production of the crystals, which are made of uric acid, so the enzyme targeted by the medication is Xanthine oxidase, which is responsible for the conversion of purines to uric acid. Hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT) is an enzyme involved in the salvage pathway of purine synthesis and is deficient in Lesch-Nyhan syndrome. Adenosine deaminase (ADA) is an enzyme involved in the breakdown of purines and is deficient in severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID). Aminolevulinic acid synthetase (ALAS) is the first enzyme in the pathway of heme synthesis and deficiencies can cause porphyrias.
